CE01.name: Auction Squad
CE01.detail_description:
Round 1 :-

       Simple Quiz Test (Technologies and basic programming). PPT will be shown on projector and there will be a quizmaster for reading and explaining all questions (Technologies and basic programming). Total marks will be 50. This round will be approx 20-30 minutes.

Round 2 :-

       Puzzles to earn tokens. Tokens will be earned on the basis of time completion of the puzzle (both the players will earn individually and it will be added at the end) with the total earned tokens will conduct an auction. 2 programming languages, 2 programs and extra time will be auctioned. This round will be of 30 minutes.

Round 3:-

       Now with the earned language and program both will have to code to complete the final round. There will be swapping within the players of the same team after 5 mins and they'll continue coding each other’s code (extra time can be used by them during swapping or at the end). Extra time if left unused will be added to their scores.
CE01.coordinator:
Manali Shah - 9408275070
Dewanshi Yadav - 7096691638

CE02.name: The Hunter
CE02.detail_description:
Round 1 :-

       First round is supposed to be an onpaper event where the participants will be required to solve certain amount of questions that'll lead them to the destination of their second round.

Round 2 :-

       Second round would be conducted in labs where each team would be assigned a pc(each team gets one), there they'll get certain puzzles and questions that'll again lead them to their 3rd round location preferable outside the CE/ IT building.

Round 3 :-

       After reaching the third-round location, they'll solve a puzzle that'll be given to them by a volunteer who'll be present there. The order in which the teams returns with the correct answers to the coordinators determines the winner.
CE02.coordinator:
Parin Modi - 9624242247
Pooja Patel - 9601477882

IT01.name: Techno-Geek
IT01.detail_description:
Ultimate pro in computers are people having the triple tackle minds, The participant wins only because of overall knowledge of hardware, software and designing.

Round 1 :-

       Hardware quiz, 20 questions, 30mins, moderate to difficult questions on hardware.

Round 2 :-

        Coding problem/ OS related questions (optional).

Round 3 :-

        Designing challenge, using any platform like html, swing(java) to make the most user friendly page.

IT02.name: Code-A-Thon
IT02.one_line_description: Hardcore programming event for hardcore programmers.
IT02.detail_description: Two rounds of coding problems. A a mind sport in which involving participants trying to program according to provided specifications. Problem is set of logical or mathematical problems to the contestants. Contestants are required to write computer programs capable of solving each problem. Judging is based mostly upon number of problems solved and time spent for writing successful solutions, but may also include other factors (quality of output produced, execution time, program size, etc.)

EC01.name: Flash N Dash
EC01.detail_description:
Task :

Design and construct a remote controlled robot capable of fighting a one on one tournament.

Specifications:

Dimensions and Fabrications:

The machine should fit in a  box of dimension 750mm x 750mm x 1000 mm ( l x b x h) at any given point during the match. The external device used to control the machine or any external task is not included in the size constraint.

The machine should not exceed 58.967 kg (130 pounds) and should be more than 22.6796 kg(50pounds) of weight including the weight of pneumatic source/tank. All pneumatic tanks/source and batteries should be on board. Weight or remove controller will not be counted.

Team Specification:

Any team can participate in Real Steel, Cognizance 2017 may consist of a maximum of 6 participants. These participants can be from or different institutes.

Team Name:

Every team must have a name which must be unique. Cognizance 2017 reserves the right to reject any Team whose name it deems inappropriate, offensive of conflicting. Organizers must be notified during if a Team’s name has been changed.

Team Representative:

Each team must specify their Team Representative (Leader) at the time of registration. All important communications between Cognizance 2017 and the registered team will be done through their team representatives. The team representatives must submit valid contact details (Phone number, Email ID, etc) at the time of registration.
EC01.coordinator:
Shubham Patel - 9033365415
Neel Bhatt - 8460927255

EC02.detail_description:
Task :

  • Design and construct a remote controlled robot capable of fighting a one on one tournament.

Specifications:

Dimensions and Fabrications:

       The machine should fit in a  box of dimension 750mm x 750mm x 1000 mm ( l x b x h) at any given point during the match. The external device used to control the machine or any external task is not included in the size constraint. The machine should not exceed 58.967 kg (130 pounds) and should be more than 22.6796 kg(50pounds) of weight including the weight of pneumatic source/tank. All pneumatic tanks/source and batteries should be on board. Weight or remove controller will not be counted.

Team Specification:

        Any team can participate in Real Steel, Cognizance 2017 may consist of a maximum of 6 participants. These participants can be from or different institutes.

Team Name:

       Every team must have a name which must be unique. Cognizance 2017 reserves the right to reject any Team whose name it deems inappropriate, offensive of conflicting. Organizers must be notified during if a Team’s name has been changed.

All important communications between Cognizance 2017 and the registered team will be done through their team representatives. EC03.name: Sum-O-Strike
EC03.one_line_description: Design a wired/wireless robot controlled manually that can withstand and perform the following rounds.
EC03.detail_description:
Task: Design a wired/wireless robot controlled manually that can withstand and perform the following rounds.

Round 1: Road To Glory

       In this round, Two Robots will fight for their chance to go ahead in the Game (Not of thrones). Passing the hurdles placed along the Track till the Arena, The team to gain maximum points promoted to next level. à

Round 2: Survival Series

       Tired of the race? This round needs the power of a sumo, and to be the best (Like the best sumo wrestler, Taiho Koki), all you have to do is to kick your opponent out of the ring. The one in the ring till the end goes directly to the final face off.

Round 3: Ultimate Face-Off

       Save your best for the last. This round will definitely require your best speed and power, as a Soccer match will require both. Beat your opponent to be the Ultimate Champion.

Robot Specifications:

       The robot should be manually controlled using a remote controller, operated by a team member. The Robot dimensions should not exceed 300*200*200mm (l*b*h) at all times.( External controlling devices and power supplies will not be considered in the size constraint). The robot can be prepared with maximum 24 Volts of battery (Not more than that). The robot should only have V-Shaped (steady) plates for playing soccer (Grippers are not allowed). Weight of robot must be less than 5kgs (Including V-Shaped plates). For Wireless communication, it is recommended to keep more than one frequencies for communication so that there is no case of electromagnetic interference with another team's wireless communication.Every team has to build their own robot by themselves, i.e. No robot constructed by readymade kits or even LEGO kits is allowed.

NOTE:

       No Extra weapons or rotors are allowed. It is also recommended that the robot should be designed to mainly play the soccer game. 

Team Specifications:

       A team can contain a maximum of 4 members. (Participants of same or different institutions can also collaborate). Every team must have a unique name to it. All the important communications between the teams and Congnizance'17 will be done through their team representative. Thus, the team representative must submit their valid contact details (Phone number, email ID, etc.) at the time of registration. The coordinators would not be held responsible for any kind of electromagnetic interference in wireless communication. CZ'17 reserves all the rights to change names of any team whose name seems to be inappropriate, offensive or conflicting. CZ'17 will not be held responsible for any type of damage to the robot.
EC03.coordinator:
Daksh Joshi - 8734009511
Nilay Shah - 9879178821

aksh Joshi - 8734009511

CE03.name: <Spiderman/>
CE03.detail_description:
ROUND 1 :- 

       In this round, there will be a single member for a particular task and two tasks I total. One is to identify as many number of superimposed logos as possible which will be a buzzer round i.e. there will only be a single member to identify a particular logo. Points will be added accordingly. Whereas the other task is to design a simple code of html in minimum number of time. One to finish it first will be awarded more points and then so on. Points of both the tasks will be added at the end. 

ROUND 2 :- 

       They will be provided, in the second round, with some design or animation which they have to code using html and CSS. Points will be awarded based on timing and perfection. 

ROUND 3 :- 

       In this round, every team will be provided with a diagram depicting a digital signal generated by using Manchester or any such technique. Decoding that in binary to decimal and then to ASCII will give them a theme which they need to design into a web page/s using html and CSS.
CE03.coordinator:
Jeel Bhalodia - 9712963779
Megha Makwana - 9408259269

CE04.name: #Coder<Strange.h>
CE04.detail_description:
Round 1 :-

       This round will be kind of an entertaining round where one team member will be made to listen songs with headphones on and that team member has to interpret what the other team member is trying to tell him. The other team member will be given a chit on which technical words will be written. He/she will be lipping or acting to convey the word.

Round 2 :-

        Here in this round the teams will be given 2 problems of reverse coding (i.e. only input and output will be given and no problem statement or description will be given) to solve in 45 minutes and along with that there will be a surprise rapid-fire round while the participants will be coding.

Round 3:-

        This round will be of 30 minutes. In this round, one participant will be made to solve the problem given and other participant will be made to solve a Sudoku problem at different place from the first participant. After 15 mins both participants will be swapped.

IT03.name: Mobile App Mockup
IT03.detail_description:
Participants are supposed to build a small live project to solve a problem with a sustainable way.

Round 1:

  • Present the solution of the problem and also explain various parameters like technology used and feasibility.

Round 2:

  • Build the small prototype or minimum viable product and present it.

IT04.name: Programmer 's Date
IT04.detail_description:
ROUND 1(Meet & Greet) :-

       A Set of MCQ and Crossword technical puzzle. The Top 30 would be advanced to Round 2. According to the score in the round 1. The participants would be made in group. Every participant would be made in group with either girl or boy accordingly.

Round 2 (Know The Surrounding) :-

       This round is same as you played your childhood game Name, Place ,Animal , Thing. In this round one partner picks up the cheat which is full of Letters A-Z . And the other participant has to write Accordingly the Keyword, Android App, IT Company starting from that Letter. Each correct word will be of 1 mark. Top 8 would be advanced to Round 3.

Round 3 (Together Forever) :-

        This round would be the buzzer round the team which answers more questions wins.

EC04.name: Lord of Lines
EC04.detail_description:
Task:-

The objective of this contest is for a robot to follow a black line on a white background, without losing the line, and navigating several 90 degree turns. The robot to complete the course in the shortest period of time while accurately tracking the course line from start to finish wins.

Round 1 :- 

       In this round, the bot will have to perform a simple line following task to simply justify if its working is upto the mark. If a bot successfully completes this circuit it will be eligible to be promoted to the next challenge if failed to do so it will be disqualified for the further rounds.

Round 2 :-

       In this challenge the bot will have to face a bit more rugged route consisting of sharp edged turns, smooth curves and also changes in the terrain. The best performers from this round shall be qualified for the next and final challenge.

Round 3 :-

       This round will be consisting of different paths that the bot will have to decide for itself. One path shall be quite easier but speed will be the determining factor whereas the other will be quite difficult but won’t have any speed criteria and there will be a final surprise so be ready :P

Rules :-

Robot Specifications : 

        Weight = 500 gms

        Dimensions = 300x200x200mm (L x B x H)

        Robot Control = Autonomous

       Line Followers must be self contained, and not externally operated by wire or by remote radio control during the race. Except for the battery pack, the handler shall not make any addition, removal, replacement or change to the hardware of a Line Follower during a contest. It is however permissible to make minor repairs.

       Course Time : Time is measured from the time the robot crosses the starting line until the time it crosses the finish line. A robot is deemed to have crossed the line when the forward most wheel, track, or leg of the robot contacts or crosses over the line.

       Autonomous Control : Once a robot has crossed the starting line it must remain fully autonomous, or it will be disqualified.An area around the field will be designated as the GAME ZONE. No one is allowed inside the game zone except for the robot handlers and the referees.

       Losing the Line : Any robot that loses the line course must reacquire the line at the point where it was lost, or at any earlier (e.g. already traversed) point. 

       Second Attempt : Any robot that loses the line course and fails to reacquire it will be allowed a single reattempt. The robot must start the course again from the beginning, and if it loses the line course on its second attempt it will be disqualified.

       TRIAL : There is no limit for the number of restarts within the TRIAL period.

       Scoring : RACE TIME is the time considered for tracing the route from START to FINISH. RACE TIME is calculated automatically by the on-field optical sensors that detect the robot’s movement. The robot that will have the fastest run will win the competition.

Team Specifications :

       A team can contain a maximum of 4 members. (Participants of same or different institutions can also collaborate). Every team must have a unique name to it. All the important communications between the teams and CZ'17 will be done through their team representative. Thus, the team representative must submit their valid contact details (Phone number, email ID, etc.) at the time of registration. The coordinators would not be held responsible for any kind of electromagnetic interference in wireless communication. CZ'17 reserves all the rights to change names of any team whose name seems to be inappropriate, offensive or conflicting. CZ'17 will not be held responsible for any type of damage to the robot.

Code of Conduct

Fair Play :-

       Robots that cause deliberate interference with other robots or damage to the field will be disqualified. Humans that cause deliberate interference with robots or damage to the field will be disqualified. It is expected that the aim of all teams is to play a fair and clean game.

Behavior :-

       Participants who misbehave may be asked to leave the competition area and risk being disqualified from the contest. The rules will be enforced at the discretion of the referees, officials, and local law enforcement authorities.

Organisers' Decision :-

The organisers reserve the right to make changes to any of the above in the interest of fair play and sportsmanship, and to ensure that all competitors have an enjoyable competition. . In the event of ambiguity, the organisers' interpretation of any clauses of the rules shall prevail.

EE01.name: ELECTRO TAZER
EE01.detail_description:
This event is gonna test your knowledge as an electrical engineer but while be done in a Game show theme style. There will be various rounds that will demand you to push your brains beyond its limits.

 ROUND 1: Technical quiz with a twist.

        Technical quiz with the twist , the quiz will be containing 10 questions and the answer will be puzzled in a puzzle given at the last of the paper. For a better understanding a quiz is there at the end of the newspaper same as that.

Round 2: E-do

       In this round the trending game LUDO will be played by four teams in this round and there will be the twist of having the capacitor resistor and inductor and their characteristics implemented in the fun game of LUDO.

 Resistor :-

       The player will have to go in the reverse direction twice the no of the dice.

Capacitor :-

       The player will go in the same direction by twice of the no coming on the dice.

Inductor :-

       The player will get trap in it so the one will loose a chance.

Round 3: Shot me down

        In this round there will be two teams facing one another and the round will be such that,

1st team: The one will be connected with electric ckt and the same team men will be shooting and collect.

2nd team:  From the opponent team, one player will be chosen for the protection or the gunman.

The opponent team men will defend the ball for getting the point. Any safe by the opponent team will be affecting the man connected in the circuit.

Rules :-

1) All The Points Will Be Decided As Per The Event Coordinators And Crew Members .

2) The Rounds Will Be Eliminating Rounds.

3) No Objections Arguments Will Be Allowed After The Declaration Of The Result.

Rules For Round2 :-

1)Only One Member Of The Team Will Be Allowed To Play.

Rules For Round3 :-

1)No Arguments Will Be Taken Into Consideration About Whether The Team Want To Throw A Ball Or Not Whatever You Get You Have To Play
EE01.coordinator:
SHANI BIREN PATEL - 9824196699

MALAY N TANNA - 9879080370

EE02.name: Dr. Cable
EE02.detail_description:
Live wires are dangerous!!! Everyone knows that..But how do you tackle that problem??? This event will test your application based skills as an electrical engineering, mainly related to house wiring and fault detections. This event might SHOCK you to the very core…

ROUND 1: Technical quiz

       The quiz will be containing technical questions

Round 2: House wiring

      In this round we will conduct a basic wiring based competition which having room wiring or shop wiring with using Two-way switch ,wires , plug socket ,fan regulator etc.

Round 3: Treasure hunt or puzzle

       In this round there will be some puzzle or some question. in this round team need to solve that puzzle and get answer

Round 4: Finale round

        In this round group will get some circuit and task related to godown wiring or industrial wiring. In this round there will some task  having some conditions and problem statement and the teams need to be fulfil the given condition and wire the connections accordingly to complete the problem with the given conditions.

 

RULES:

1) All the points will be decided as per the event coordinators and crew members.

2) The members in each team will be two.

3) The rounds will be eliminating rounds

4) Final authority of winner declaration and change in result is in the  hands of the event coordinators and crew and NO ARGUMENTS WILL BE TAKEN INTO CONSIDERATION.

EE03.name: ENIGMA
EE03.detail_description:
Name seems a bit crytic…Don’t worry the event ain’t that crytic. This event tests you coding skills. You can use C/C++ or MATLAB.. The problem statement might be electrical based but the basic logic can be grasped by anyone no matter what stream they belong to. So without hesitation, join in and know what coding is to an electrical engineer.

Round 1: Hyperion

The test determines the power of observation and general technical ability through series of tasks. The result of test will not be accounted for final declaration of winner.

Round 2: Burn it on!

Round 2 consist of two task.

Task 1 :- The technical quiz focusing on C programming concepts, Embedded C with Keil, MATLAB scripting, will be offered on the choice. Mainly it may cover quiz on general programming concepts, finding the Errors in programs, debugging it and a surprise task to be solved in stipulated time limit.

Task 2 :-  Here in this task, participants will have to write program for the given objective and selected software platform. The participants are strictly not allowed to use their Computer and software.

Round 3: Brainiac

       The participants are expected here to simulate (mainly in case of MATLAB) or develop a program matching the real work applications.

RULES AND REGULATIONS:

1. The organizers have all rights reserved to modify/change any event/task/assignment at any time without prior information to participants but Mainly in case of hanging situation, the task to discriminate the performance between to equal performers will be decided instinctively by the organizers.

2. You may choose the programming language available in List only through out any round of competition. It’s not compulsory to maintain it throughout.

       Using mobile or internet is strictly prohibited but you may use any programmable calculator. Nothing will be provided other than computer and related software.

EE04.name: TECH-NEXT
EE04.detail_description:
Have you seen TVF’s Pitchers?? Now why don’t you get a taste of what Naveen and his friends faced. Think of an innovative idea and present it in front of experts…Now lets see whether you have the skills to become Technocrat.

Team Specification:

       These participants can be from same or different institutes.Each team will have 2 members.Team Name: Every team must have a name which must be unique.Every team must have a team representative who must submit valid contact details (phone no., email ID etc.) at the time of registration.

ROUND-1 : QUIZ

       This round will be conducted only if the entries would exceed more than 30 teams.In this round a quiz will be conducted among all the teams. The questions can be over current affairs or technical and management related. So each team is expected to prepare accordingly.

RULES :-

1) In this round, teams will be given 20 MCQ type of questions to solve.

2) Result of this round will be declared at 12:00AM

3) 20 teams having maximum number of correct answers will be selected

4) Each team will be given participation certificate after the round 1

 

ROUND 2: SURVEYING

·       All the teams will be allowed to visit the campus for an hour. During that visit, the teams have to select anyone product, which can be present in the campus or not.(electrical products will be preferred). Based on the product, they have to find as much as information they can. In case they find any trouble then they can contact faculty for any doubt related to their product. They should be well aware of their product because question/answers will be conducted either by the crew or faculty. The selection will be done over the basis of their research and the questions asked to them. After this round, only 10 teams will be selected for the next round.

ROUND 3: PRESENTATION

       The teams shortlisted will be given one day time to prepare their presentation. They wil be given the product name at the end of round 2. The PPT should not consist of more than 10 slides. They can include logo, slogans, company’s name, etc. Even if someone doesn’t want to present their presentation through PPT, then they can prepare brochures, posters, etc and speak over it verbally.

ME01.name: Aqua Man
ME01.detail_description:
Participants will have to build a boat that can sustain in adverse conditions. They can use only motorized mechanism to propel the boat. The boats can be wired or wireless depending upon the choice of participant.

Round 1 :-
       The first round will be the qualification round, where the basic testing of boat will be done, like its endurance, floatability, weight considerations. This round will be played on Day 1. Weight : Not more than 3 kilograms.
Round 2 :- 
       The next round will be the racing round, where in top 5 boats will be qualified for the next and final round. This round will also be played on Day 1.
Round 3 :-
       Final round will consist of the final race between all the 5 finalists in which they will have to cross various obstacles like rain, high tides, oily surface, twists and turns. This round will also be played on Day 2.

ME02.name: Space Boy
ME02.detail_description:
Participants need to make a pressurized jet rocket out of a plastic bottle that can fly up to maximum height. They can pressurize it using a bicycle pump, that they need to bring with themselves. No pressure filling device will be provided.
Plastic bottle specs : Not more than 1 lit bottle.
Presure gauge spec : Pressure gauge are compulsory to be installed in the device. Participants will NOT be provided with the pressure gauge at the time of filling the air. They need to bring their own pressure filling instruments.
 
Round 1 :- 
       First will be the quarter final round, wherein the top 4 rockets will be qualified.
Round 2 :- 
       Next will be the quarter final round, wherein the top 2 rockets will be qualified.
Round 3 :- 
       Last will be the quarter final round, wherein the highest rocket will be declared the winner.
 
This event will be on Day 1.

ME03.name: Mr. Hydra-ulic
ME03.detail_description:
Participants will have to make a robotic arm using hydraulic syringe mechanism. 
Round 1 :-
       The first round will be qualification round, where the robotic arms will have to press a buzzer placed in a complex box. The arm can have attachments like magnets, piercer, holders for pick-and-place function. 
Round 2 :-
       Three different items will be provided which will have to be picked up and placed in the marked area in a limited amount of time.
 
       Use of electronic or electrical components is strictly prohibited.Size of arm should not exceed 50cm x 50cm x 50cm.
 
       This event will be on Day 2.

ME04.name: Brainiac
ME04.detail_description:
This is basically a Quiz Contest on the technical and theoretical aspects Mechanical Engineering.
Round 0 :-
       This will be the elimination round, where in top 8 teams will be selected based upon a screening test on Mechanical Engineering.
Round 1 :-
       Basics of all the fields of mechanical engineering. Time per question = 10 seconds. Marks : +10, pass.
Round 2 :-
       Practical aspects of the theories. Time per question = 10 sec. Marks = +10, pass.
Round 3 :-
       Current innovations in the field of technology. Time per Question = 10 sec. Marks : +10, pass
Round 4 :-
       Rapid Fire.  Time = 60 sec. 12 questions. Marks = +10
Round 5 :-
       Buzzer Round. Time per Question = 10 sec. Marks : +10, -5, Double, No pass.
 
This event will be on Day 2.

ME05.name: CAD-Man
ME05.detail_description:
The participant designs the Given CAD Model in the stipulated time using CREO software.
 
This event will be on Day 1.
